Xiaowen Chen

PhD candidate at Princeton University

Home Research Publications CV Software

       

Since 09/2015 – PhD in Physics, Princeton University

Work with Bill Bialek and Andy Leifer on collective behavior in neural networks.

2011-2015 – BA Integrated Science, Math, Physics, Northwestern University

Research experience through a bachelor thesis with Adilson E. Motter, two-year research experience with Brian C. Odom on cold molecular ion experiment and simulation, a summer REU with Fred Rasio and Yoram Lithwick on binary star transfers, and a summer internship with Matthew H. Johnson on archaeology.

Honors and Awards

2015: Joseph Henry Prize, Princeton University

2015: Thesis prize, Northwestern University
